commit.message:
Decouple Docker build service from Maven

This is related to #30
Added tests and license headers to new files
Removed Maven dependency from build api/ and service/

beforeCommit.message:
Removed common-maven/ from build/ module

+ Got rid of plexus dependency

afterCommit.message:
Removed common-maven/ from build/ module

+ Got rid of plexus dependency

nodes.bodyText: Add a private constructor so that we enforce the use of the singleton.

This looks really messy.
I guess this is like this for deserialization?
In any case it would be good to have a proper POJO to represent this "settings" structure.
No need to add throws IllegalStateException it's a RuntimeException > remove from method signature.

Please, name static constants in Uppercase.
These the most basic language coding conventions used across any Java code-base. It's very important to name things following this foundation guidelines as when we Java coders read code with certain letter-case we assume the named entity is a class, package, instance, constant, etc.

Better to use a specific POJO to represent the Plugins object.
Javadoc description looks outdated and inaccurate.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -180,6 +149,55 @@ public static Plugin getPluginOfAnyGroupId(MavenProject project, String pluginAr
         return getPlugin(project, null, pluginArtifact);
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Returns a comma separated string with dependency list in format
+     *  groupId,artifactId,version,configuration,execution1|execution2|execution3
+     *
+     * @param project Maven project
+     * @return list of dependencies in comma separated strings
+     */
+    public static List<AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<String, Map<String, Object>>> getPluginsAsString(MavenProject project) {

nodes.bodyText:
As in previous comment, better to use a specific typed POJO to represent this structure.
This is tightly related to the comment in RegistryService.Builder#settings where you are eventually converting what we return here to List<RegistryServerConfiguration>

What is 63?
Declare a constant with a descriptive name please.

Is this OK?
getArtifacts returns all dependencies in the project.
Just to be sure, does getDependenciesWithTransitive return all dependencies too?
Inconsistent with the code-style in the rest of the code base, check IDE settings.
No need to add throws IllegalStateException  it's a RuntimeException > remove from method signature.
Try to always use Collections.emptyList() (typed) instead of Collections.EMPTY_LIST (raw type)
Constant, please use correct letter-case: JKUBE_PLUGINS

Please, see other comments regarding specific POJOS for configuration entities and their deserialization.
Deserializing something into a Map and then accessing keys through String will eventually end up in a very difficult to detect BUG.
Is this file actually supposed to be in this branch?
Is this file supposed to be in this branch?
